table.column: Only fools laugh while warriors die.
Nur Narren lachen während Krieger sterben.

The object is the thing being soaked or drenched.
{HaH'egh:v@@HaH:v:1, -'egh:v} is used to refer to drinking a great deal, or bathing.[1, p.91]

Объектом является вещь, которую мочат или замачивают.
{HaH'egh:v@@HaH:v:1, -'egh:v} использовано, чтобы упомянуть о купании или о том, когда много пьют.[1, p.91]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used by upper-class speakers for {gham:n} served as food.

Слово, используется носителями языка высшего класса для {gham:n} служащего едой

{vav:n} "father", or colloquially "pop", and {jaH:v} "go" together make "pop goes the weasel".

melaço, xarope, um líquido feito principalmente de açúcar

Sugar is not a native Klingon thing. Klingon {Halrov:n:nolink}, made by boiling the stems of a particular plant (and then doing some other things), is a thick, sticky, gooey liquid, but it's not sweet. If specificity is needed, one can say {Su'ghar Halrov:n:nolink} or {Su'ghar qut Halrov:n@@Su'ghar qut:n, Halrov:n} for the Terran concoction.[1]

Tämä viittaa erään kasvin juuria kiehuttamalla valmistettavaan ei-makeaan, paksuun, tahmaiseen siirappiseen nesteeseen. Sanoja {Su'ghar Halrov:n:nolink} ja {Su'ghar qut Halrov:n@@Su'ghar qut:n, Halrov:n} voi käyttää, jos haluaa viitata erityisesti sokerista tehtyyn siirappiin.[1]

The word "treacle" was used in Middle English to describe a medicine believed to be an antidote which can cure ({vorlaH:sen@@vor:v, -laH:v}) poisons, snakebites, and other ills.
This was defined as "treacle, syrup" in {QelIS boqHarmey:src} and expanded to include "jam, jelly, preserves" at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2024:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a very general term covering oils of all kinds, including petroleum and seed oils and more.[1]
Backwards of {HISlaH:excl}. A reference to the "langues d'oïl", which are named for the word for "yes" in their recent ancestral languages.

table.name: mem
table.column: This might refer to a high voice, or a high note in music.
To "ham it up" is to do something ridiculous as to make people laugh.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a wound or sore with at least some abrasion, not just a bruise.

table.name: mem
table.column: For the plural, {-mey:n} is used even if the scab is still attached.
Für den Plural wird {-mey:n} verwendet, auch wenn der Schorf noch angebracht ist.
When it was first revealed, the {DIr:sen:nolink} was accidentally dropped. This was corrected in the Q & A session.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a two-syllable verb, and it's slang.
Dies ist ein zweisilbiges Verb und es ist Slang.
This was confirmed intransitive during the Q & A session.

A teacher held in high esteem might be called a {ghojmoHwI' Han:n@@ghojmoHwI':n, Han:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the seed of a Klingon vegetable, which is a green ball found inside a pod ({manta':n:nolink}).[1]

table.name: mem

Isso significa literalmente "realizar cirurgia" ({Haq:v:1}) e é usado apenas se o consertador realmente souber o que está fazendo

table.name: mem
table.column:
In ascending order of ferocity, the verbs used to describe military confrontations are: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v:nolink}.
This verb would be reserved only for situations approaching Armageddon.[1]
В порядке убывания свирепости, используются следующие глаголы, для описания военных противостояний: {Qor:v}, {tlhaS:v}, {vay:v}, {lul:v}, {Hargh:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to something like a medical condition that affects someone mentally or physically.
Dies bezieht sich auf einen medizinischen Zustand, die jemanden geistig oder körperlich betrifft.
The Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990 was authored by Senator Tom Harkin.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Over the Rainbow" was composed by Harold Arlen and its lyrics were written by E.Y. Harburg.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used not only for animals. It can also be used for the sound an old door or a wooden chest makes when you open it, if it's a sort of high pitch.
Isso é usado não apenas para animais. Também pode ser usado para o som que uma porta velha ou um baú de madeira faz quando você a abre, se for uma espécie de tom agudo.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word actually means "video" (i.e., moving visual images). When used by itself on a ship, as part of ship's jargon, however, it refers to the "visual display" mode of a viewing screen (see {HaSta:n:2}).[2]
Note that {jIH:n:2} refers to the device, while {HaSta:n:1,nolink} refers to the visual information displayed on it.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is actually the word "video" (see {HaSta:n:1}) which, when used by itself on a ship, as part of ship's jargon, refers to the "visual display" mode of a viewing screen.[2]
Contrast this with {wIy:n:2,nolink}, which is another display mode of a {jIH:n:2,nolink}.

This was defined as just "visual display" in {TKD:src}.[1] Its exact meaning was clarified at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2023:src}.[2]
Interesting coincidence: in the Spanish phrase "Hasta la vista" ("see you later"), "la vista" means "the view".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is literally a "video viewing screen".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is shortened from {HaSta jIH much:n}[1], and refers to the content presented on a TV screen.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a specific video file.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
Maltz had a hunch this was shortened at some point from {HaSta 'ay':n@@HaSta:n:2, 'ay':n}, but that may be a folk etymology.[1]
This resembles the actual etymology of "pixel", which is shortened from "picture element".

table.name: mem
table.column: In slang, stolen goods are said to be "hot".

For "random" in the sense of numbers, as when throwing dice, use {'al:v:2} instead.

Esimerkiksi {yergho Hay:sen:nolink} tarkoittaisi "alue kaupunginmuurin ulkopuolella" ja {qachvetlh Hay:sen:nolink} tarkoittaisi "kaikki alue tuosta talosta eteenpäin".
alue takana, alue ulkopuolella, alue eteenpäin

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a controlled roll. If a person is rolling haphazardly, the verb to use is {ron:v:1}. If someone is rolling down a hill (like a log), see {tetlh:v}.

The song "Being for the Benefit of Mr. Kite!" by The Beatles has a line about the circus performer John Henderson, referred to as "Mr. H" ({Hay:n:1}), which goes "Ten somersets he'll undertake on solid ground".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is typically round (so it could be a {'Ib rutlh:n@@'Ib:n, rutlh:v}) and portable (so it's not a {qegh:n}).[1]
Hyacinth Bucket is a character on the British sitcom "Keeping Up Appearances" (who insists that her surname is to be pronounced "bouquet").

table.name: mem
table.column:
To challenge someone to a duel, say {qablIj HI'ang!:sen} (This is often shortened to {HI'ang!:sen:nolink}) It is said of the party issuing the challenge that {qabDaj 'ang:sen@@qab:n, -Daj:n, 'ang:v} "he/she shows his/her face". The act of issuing the challenge is {poQ:v}, which is short for {qab legh 'e' poQ:sen@@qab:n, legh:v, 'e':n, poQ:v} "He/she demands to see a face". Hitting one's adversary with the back of the hand ({chap:n}) while issuing the challenge is to demand a duel to the death ({Hay'chu':v}).[2]
To agree to the duel, say {vISo'be':sen@@vI-:v, So':v:1, -be':v} "I don't hide it" (or the longer {qabwIj vISo'be'.:sen} "I don't hide my face"). The challenged party is then said to {'angchu':sen@@'ang:v, -chu':v} (short for {qab 'angchu':sen@@qab:n, 'ang:v, -chu':v}). One accepts a challenge ({qab 'ang:sen@@qab:n, 'ang:v}) in order to prove one's honor ({quv tob:sen@@quv:n, tob:v}).[2]
▶ {Hay' chaH.:sen:nolink} "They duel."[2] ▶ {Hay'chuq.:sen:nolink} "They duel one another."[2] ▶ {'avwI' Hay' yaS.:sen:nolink} "The officer duels the guard."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is just the verb {Hay':v} with the suffix {-chu':v}. From the Klingon point of view, to duel perfectly is to duel to the death.[1]
▶ {Hay'chu' chaH.:sen:nolink} "They duel to the death."[1] ▶ {Hay'chuqchu'.:sen:nolink} "They duel one another to the death."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: For different ways in which meat may be prepared, see {wamwI' Ha'DIbaH:n}, {voDleH Ha'DIbaH:n}, and {qeyvaq Ha'DIbaH:n}.
Для описания различных способов приготовления мяса, смотрите {wamwI' Ha'DIbaH:n}, {voDleH Ha'DIbaH:n}, и {qeyvaq Ha'DIbaH:n}. Также может использоваться, как легкое оскорбление

A lip movement match for "animal".
This was defined as "animal" in {TKD:src}, but as "meat, animal" in {TKDA:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: For a specific kind of steak, substitute the meat type for {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: For a specific kind of bacon, substitute the meat type for {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Substitute the meat type for {Ha'DIbaH:n:1}. For example, {gham na' tIr ngogh:n@@gham na':n, tIr ngogh:n} for "ham sandwich".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Do not kill an animal unless you intend to eat it.
Töte kein Tier, wenn du nicht vorhast, es zu essen.
حیوان را کشتن ندهید مگر اینکه قصد داشته باشید آن را بخورید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Död inte ett djur om du inte tänker äta det. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Не убивай животное, если не намерен его съесть!
除非你打算吃它，否則不要殺死動物。
Não mate um animal a menos que você pretenda comê-lo.
Älä tapa eläintä, ellet aio syödä sitä.
Ne tuez pas un animal à moins que vous ayez l'intention de le manger. [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is what Klingons would call the Terran food.
So würden Klingonen das terranische Essen nennen.
Это то, что Клингоны называют земной пищей

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the little piece of metal that holds sheets of paper together.
Dies bezieht sich auf das kleine Stück Metall, das die Blätter zusammenhält.
Marc Okrand has said that this word has a somewhat complicated pun, and it's not related to the Biblical Noah.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object of {vev:v} is {Ha'on:n}. The papers stapled together are the object of {rar:v}.[1]
To use such a device, one may {qIp:v}, {'uy:v}, or {ngaH:v} it, depending on the particular device.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: In ancient times, this supported a sword. Now it is symbolic of one's {tuq:n}.
In der Antike stützte dies ein Schwert. Jetzt ist es ein Symbol für das {tuq:n}.
В древние времена использовалась для ношения меча. Сейчас это символ {tuq:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The expression {Ha'qujlIj nge':sen:nolink} "take away your sash" means "wound your pride".
Der Ausdruck {Ha'qujlIj nge':sen:nolink} "jemandes Schärpe wegnehmen" bedeutet "jemandes Stolz verletzen".
Выражение {Ha'qujlIj nge':sen:nolink} "сними свою перевязь" значит "ущеми свою гордость".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word can only refer to a physical route, and not to a spiritual or metaphorical route. "The Klingon Way", for example, is {tlhIngan tIgh:n:nolink}.
A physical path (which one can see and walk on) would be a {taw:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Ha'DIbaH DaSop 'e' DaHechbe'chugh yIHoHQo'.:sen} ▶ {Hem tlhIngan Segh 'ej maHemtaH 'e' wIHech.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column:
"Head" off.
This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.

table.name: mem
table.column: retreat perfectly, make a full withdrawal
عقب نشینی کنید، یک خروج کامل بگیرید [AUTOTRANSLATED]
reträtt perfekt, gör en fullständig återkallelse [AUTOTRANSLATED]
recuar perfeitamente, fazer uma retirada completa
se replier parfaitement, faire une retraite complète

This is just the verb {HeD:v} with the suffix {-chu':v}. While the suffix {-chu':v} is used with some verbs of fighting to imply that the fight results in death (see {Suvchu':v} and {Hay'chu':v}), there is no such implication with {HeDchu':v:nolink}. Though death may occur as part of the retreat, it is not necessarily implied.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The fact that {yIn:v} can be used transitively suggests that {Hegh:v:nolink} can be too.
Die Tatsache, dass {yIn:v} transitiv verwendet werden kann, legt nahe, dass {Hegh:v:nolink} dies auch sein kann.
Фактически {yIn:v} может быть использована транзитивно. Как и {Hegh:v:nolink}.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: ▶ {Hegh Duj DatIj 'ej ghe'torDaq Duqeng.:sen:nolink} "Barge of the Dead ferries you to Gre'thor!"
▶ {Hegh Duj DatIj 'ej ghe'torDaq Duqeng.:sen:nolink} "Баржа мертвых переправит тебя в Гретор!"

table.name: mem
table.column: A fool's only achievement is death.
Das einzige, was ein Narr erreicht, ist der Tod.
En dum är bara prestation är döden. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
傻瓜的唯一成就就是死亡。
A única conquista de um tolo é a morte.
La seule réussite d'un imbécile est la mort.

table.name: mem
table.column: This may also be written as {Heghba':n:nolink}.
Dies kann auch als {Heghba':n:nolink} geschrieben werden.
It is written {Heghba':n:nolink} in the novel "Sarek".

table.name: mem
table.column: When a warrior dies, his spirit escapes.
Wenn ein Krieger stirbt, entflieht sein Geist.
هنگامی که یک جنگجو می میرد، روح او فرار می کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
När en krigare dör, flyr hans anda. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Когда воин умирает, его дух вырывается
當一個戰士死去時，他的靈魂逃脫了。
Quando um guerreiro morre, seu espírito escapa.
Kun soturi kuolee, hänen henkensä pakenee.
Lorsqu'un guerrier meurt, son esprit s'échappe.
The verb {nargh:v:2} means "escape", but it (or a phonetically identical word) also means "appear" (see {nargh:v:1}).
Глагол {nargh:v:2} означает "сбегать", но он также значит "появляться" (см. {nargh:v:1}).

table.name: mem
table.column: Death is an experience best shared.
Der Tod ist eine Erfahrung, die man am besten teilt.
مرگ یک تجربه به اشتراک گذاشته شده است. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Döden är en erfarenhet som är bäst delad. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Смерть это опыт, который передается лучше всего
死亡之經驗最佳是分享的。
A morte é uma experiência melhor compartilhada.
La mort est une expérience qu’il vaut mieux partager.
A version of this phrase with the typo {QaQpu':sen:nolink} (instead of {QaQqu':sen:nolink}) seems to have propagated online.

table.name: mem
table.column: It is a good day to die.
Heute ist ein guter Tag zum Sterben.
Det är en bra dag att dö. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
É um bom dia para morrer.
Aujourd'hui est un beau jour pour mourir.

table.name: mem
table.column: быть фатальным, быть смертельным, быть роковым
olla kohtalokas, kuolettava, tappava jollekulle; tappaa
The definition in {TKD:src} only says "be fatal", but it's clear that the verb takes an object since it is formed using {-moH:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: See under {Hegh bey:n} for a description of this ritual.
Eine Beschreibung dieses Rituals ist zu finden unter {Hegh bey:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In {TNK:src}, {bIQ'a' HeH:n} is used to translate "beach". In the {paq'batlh:src}, {ngeng HeH:n} is used to translate "lakeshore".
In {TNK:src} wird {bIQ'a' HeH:n} für "Strand" verwendet. Im {paq'batlh:src} wird {ngeng HeH:n} für "Seeufer" verwendet.
В {TNK:src}, {bIQ'a' HeH:n} используется, как "берег моря". В {paq'batlh:src}, {ngeng HeH:n} используется, как "берег озера".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the border of an article of clothing doubled back and stitched together to finish the edge and prevent it from fraying.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an admirable trait and does not carry connotations of arrogance, for which see {nguq:v}.
Dies ist eine bewundernswerte Eigenschaft und enthält keine Konnotationen der Arroganz, für letztere siehe {nguq:v}.
Используется в контексте восхищения. Для описания высокомерия, смотрите {nguq:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Klingons are a proud race, and we intend to go on being proud.
Klingonen sind eine stolze Rasse, und wir haben vor weiterhin stolz zu sein.

This is the positive answer to a yes/no question (see {-'a':v}). Unlike the English word "yes", it is not used as a stand-alone exclamation indicating insight, joy, and so on (for which see {toH:excl} and {Qapla'!:sen}). For an exclamation indicating compliance, such as in response to a command, see {lu':excl}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was defined as "glass (tumbler)" in {TKD:src} (presumably to clarify that it doesn't refer to the material).[1] On {KGT p.78:src}, it was explained that this word refers to "a drinking glass of any kind (a goblet, tumbler, wineglass, mug)". On {KGT p.98:src}, this word is said to be used for "any sort of drinking vessel: glass, cup, mug, stein, goblet, tumbler, and so on", and it's furthermore explained that, if necessary, it can even be used for drinking vessels not normally associated with Klingon culture, such as crystal stemware.[2]

Steinway ({HIvje':n} + {He:n}) is a company which produces pianos.

table.name: mem
table.column: alla, allihop, allt, allting, varje, varenda
todos, tudo, todas as coisas, cada
tout le monde, tout, tout, chacun [AUTOTRANSLATED]

If {Hoch:n:nolink} is followed by a noun which is explicitly plural, it means "all the X's", taken collectively. If the following noun is not explicitly plural, then it means "each X", considered individually.[2]
If {Hoch:n:nolink} follows a noun, it means "all of X".[4] Note that this is different from {naQ:v} following a noun, which means "a complete X".

Tätä sanaa voi käyttää substantiivin edellä tai sen jäljessä. Jos se on substantiivin edessä ja substantiivi on monikollinen ({Hoch Xmey:sen:nolink}), se tarkoittaa "kaikki X:t" yhdessä. Jos substantiivi on yksiköllinen ({Hoch X:sen:nolink}), se tarkoittaa "kukin X" tai "jokainen X" erikseen tarkasteltuna.[2]
Jos {Hoch:n:nolink} seuraa substantiivia, se tarkoittaa "koko X".[4] Huomaa, että tämä ei ole sama kuin {naQ:v}, joka tarkoittaa "kokonainen/ehjä X".
This was defined as "everyone, all, everything" in {TKD:src}. The meaning "each" was added based on an article in {HolQeD:src}.[2]

This is an intentionally ungrammatical word.
The first item in a list of words (for example) would be {mu' wa'DIch:n@@mu':n, wa'DIch:n}, while one could say {mu' HochDIch:n@@mu':n, HochDIch:n} for the last word in the list, or use a special term for the end of a list, {natlIS:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The Klingon week has six days, which are: ▶ {DaSjaj:n} "Monday" ▶ {povjaj:n} "Tuesday" ▶ {ghItlhjaj:n} "Wednesday" ▶ {loghjaj:n} "Thursday" ▶ {buqjaj:n} "Friday" ▶ {lojmItjaj:n} or {ghInjaj:n} "Saturday"
If an alien calendar contains more than six days, additional days are numbered beginning with {wa':n:num}. Thus, "Sunday" would be {jaj wa':n}. The eighth day of the week on {lenmaq:n}, which uses an eight-day week, is called {jaj cha':n:nolink}, and so on.[2]

Клингонская неделя имеет 6 дней, которыми являются: ▶ {DaSjaj:n} "Понедельник" ▶ {povjaj:n} "Вторник" ▶ {ghItlhjaj:n} "Среда" ▶ {loghjaj:n} "Четверг" ▶ {buqjaj:n} "Пятница" ▶ {lojmItjaj:n} or {ghInjaj:n} "Суббота"
Если инопланетный календарь состоит более чем из 6 дней, дополнительные дни нумеруются начиная с {wa':n:num}. Таким образом, "Воскресенье" будет {jaj wa':n}. Восьмой день недели {jaj cha':n:nolink}, и так далее.[2]

A slang term for this is {yaD:n:3}.
{Hoj:v} means "be cautious". Since teenagers are known for not being cautious, the {nIy:sen:nolink} might be a negation word (possibly "nie" from German).

table.name: mem
table.column:
In Klingon, names of languages are formed by attaching {Hol:n:nolink} to an identifier for the language. For example, "Klingon" (the language) is {tlhIngan Hol:n}, and {tlhIngan:n} by itself does not refer to the language, but to a person or people.
The identifier is usually a country, region, or political unit of some kind. For example, Federation Standard (i.e., "English") is {DIvI' Hol:n}. {tlhIngan Hol:n:nolink} is actually a shortened form of {tlhIngan wo' Hol:n:nolink}.[2]

В Клингонском, названия языков сформированы путем прикрепления {Hol:n:nolink} к соответствующему названию языка. Например, "Клингонский язык" {tlhIngan Hol:n}, а {tlhIngan:n} сам по себе относится не к языку, а к личности.
Идентификатором обычно является страна, регион, или политический блок. Например, Стандарт Федерации (т.e., "Английский") будет {DIvI' Hol:n}. {tlhIngan Hol:n:nolink} сокращенная форма {tlhIngan wo' Hol:n:nolink}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: slang, "färskt språk" (mestadels använt av yngre klingoner)
This term is used by younger Klingons to refer to the way they prefer to speak.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also the name of the journal of the {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.
Это также название журнала {tlhIngan Hol yejHaD:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This term does not appear in canon, but is an obvious construction from {HolQeD:n}. (It was revealed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src} that if a {QeD:n:nolink} exists, then there is generally a corresponding {tej:n:nolink}.)
{Holtej:n:name,nolink} is also the Klingon name of linguist and Klingonist d'Armond Speers.

table.name: mem
table.column: weakling, runt, scrawny one, skinny one
vekling, liten en, mager en, utmärglad person
弱者、矮子、骨瘦如柴、骨瘦如柴 [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: use o segundo dedo do pé

Due to the homophony with {Hom:n:2}, to point one's second toe at someone (typically an opponent or an enemy), while the other toes point downwards, is considered an insulting gesture. It signifies that one considers the other person to be weak.
▶ {jaghwI'Daq jIHom.:sen:nolink} "I claim my enemy is unworthy or weak."

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a type of dense, non-vascular tissue, usually found at the end of joints, the rib cage, the ear, the nose, and between intervertebral disks. It is an ingredient of {ngat:n:2}.
It's not clear if {HomHap:n:nolink} exists as an independent word.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb can take {'e':n:pro} as its object.[2]
▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh 'e' vIHon.:sen:nolink} "I doubt that you speak Klingon."[2]
▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh 'e' vIHon.:sen:nolink} "Я сомневаюсь, что ты говоришь на Клингонском."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This verb is used in the same way as {Sum:v} (it involves the concept of deixis).[2]
In Klingon, "deep space" is called {logh Hop:n}, literally, "far space".[3]

Этот глагол используется, так же как и {Sum:v}.[2]
В Клингонском, "глубокий космос" будет {logh Hop:n}, что дословно значит, "дальний космос".[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used for pulling a child's wagon (by its handle) or for a train engine to pull the train along or to pull an electrical plug out of the wall.[1] For pulling a bowstring or tugging at something without moving (dragging) it, see {Hur:v}. For a sudden pull, see {luH:v:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: be honored falsely, be falsely honorable
به دروغ محترم بماند، به اشتباه محترم شمرده شود [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara falskt ärad, vara felaktigt hedrad
被虛假地稱讚、是虛假的光榮 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser honrado falsamente, ser falsamente honrado
être faussement honoré, être faussement honorable [AUTOTRANSLATED]

Deception is implied by the use of this verb.
This word is used in places where {quv:v} might be used, but when the honor was discovered to be illegitimate. For example, a {Duy quv:n:nolink} who turns out to be a spy would be called a {Duy HoQ:n:nolink}.
It differs from {quvHa':v} in that it indicates that one has demanded respect which is unearned or undeserved. A warrior who shows cowardice in battle is a {SuvwI' quvHa':n:nolink}. One who hides his cowardice, is awarded for valor (i.e., becomes known as a {SuvwI' quv:n:nolink}), and is subsequently discovered to be a fraud, is a {SuvwI' HoQ:n:nolink}.
Do not use this word lightly as it has very bad connotations in Klingon society.
be honoured falsely, be falsely honourable

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {HoS; 'Iw rur:sen@@HoS:v, 'Iw:n, rur:v}.
This verb is also used for regular polygons and polyhedra.[2]

Есть идиома, {HoS; 'Iw rur:sen@@HoS:v, 'Iw:n, rur:v}.
Глагол также используется для обычных многоугольников и многогранников.[2]
▶ {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "regular pentagon"[2]
▶ {vagh reD mey' HoS:n@@vagh reD mey':n, HoS:v} "обычный пятиугольник"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Horse" power. The character of Eric "Hoss" Cartwright on the TV show "Bonanza" has a reputation for being strong.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device which changes energy from one form to another.
Это устройство, что преобразует одну форму энергии в другую.

table.column: You are a total waste of good energy!
تو خالی از انرژی خوب هستی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Du är ett totalt slöseri med god energi! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
你是一個完全浪費能量的人！
Você é um total desperdício de boa energia!

table.name: mem
table.column: {pIraqSIS:n} is an important Klingon energy facility.
▶ {pIraqSIS HoS waw' ghajlu'chugh, loSlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey mI'; chen qav'ap.:sen:nolink} "If Praxis Energy Facility is owned, rent is 4 times amount shown on dice."

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the magnitude of a wave (such as an electromagnetic wave). This literally means "strength" (see {HoS:n:1}).

table.name: mem
table.column: {HoSDo':n:nolink} may have formerly been {HoS Do':n@@HoS:n:1, Do':n:1}. This may perhaps be translated as something like "swarm of energy," with the notion of "lifeforms" or "beings" (in this case non-corporeal) implicit in the meaning of {Do':n:1}, but it is now considered a single inherently plural noun.[2]
One energy being is a {HoS Dep:n@@HoS:n:1, Dep:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The term {HoS Hal:n:nolink} (with a space) has also appeared in canon. See the example under {nISwI' beH:n}.

▶ {HoSHal ghajchugh vay', mI' naghmey tIronmoH. wa'maHlogh boq'egh mI' naghmey; chen qav'ap. ghajwI'vaD qav'ap yIDIl.:sen:nolink} "If [energy source is] owned, throw dice and pay owner a total ten times amount shown."

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a type of hard igneous rock, which is very common in oceanic crust.
Dies bezieht sich auf eine Art hartes magmatisches Gestein, das in der ozeanischen Kruste sehr häufig vorkommt.
Basalt comes from an ancient Greek word meaning "touchstone" ({Hot:v} + {nagh:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: The homophonous {Hotlh:v:2} suggests that this verb refers to the combined act of both capturing and displaying an image.
Das gleich klingende Verb {Hotlh:v:2} legt nahe, dass sich dieses Verb auf den kombinierten Vorgang des Erfassens und Anzeigens eines Bildes bezieht.
Имеется омофон {Hotlh:v:2} прпедполагающий, что глагол относится к совмещенному действию захвата и показа изображения.

table.name: mem
table.column: The homophonous {Hotlh:v:1} suggests that this verb refers to the combined act of both capturing and displaying an image.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to an astronomical body, and not to the geometric figure, for which see {DujtlhuQ:n}.

This is defined in {TKD:src} only as "star". The "astronomy" part was added for clarification.

Отдельно от дословного перевода, как части тела, это слово может использоваться, чтобы описать "зубы" на зубчатом колесе или цепном колесе

This word follows the grammatical rules appropriate to its literal meaning (see {Ho':n:1}). It takes the plural suffix {-Du':n:suff} and possessive suffixes such as {-wIj:n:suff}, even when it refers to a person or people.[1, p.152]
This is defined in the {KGT:src} word list only as "idol". The expanded definition above is from p.152.

table.name: mem
table.column: When used with the verb {Hub:v}, the suffix {-neS:v:suff} indicates that suicide is part of the defense plan.[1]
Bei Verwendung mit dem Verb {Hub:v} zeigt das Suffix {-neS:v:suff} an, dass Selbstmord Teil des Verteidigungsplans ist.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
وقتی از فعل {Hub:v} استفاده می شود ، پسوند {-neS:v:suff} نشان می دهد که خودکشی بخشی از برنامه دفاع است.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
När det används med verbet {Hub:v} indikerar suffixet {-neS:v:suff} att självmord är en del av försvarsplanen.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
При использовании с глаголом {Hub:v} суффикс {-neS:v:suff} указывает, что самоубийство является частью плана защиты.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
與動詞{Hub:v}一起使用時，後綴{-neS:v:suff}表示自殺是防禦計劃的一部分。[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
Quando usado com o verbo {Hub:v}, o sufixo {-neS:v:suff} indica que o suicídio faz parte do plano de defesa.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kun sitä käytetään verbin {Hub:v} kanssa, loppuliite {-neS:v:suff} osoittaa, että itsemurha on osa puolustussuunnitelmaa.[1][AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: khrun, type of animal (used for riding)
This animal is known for its speed.
▶ {nom leng Hun nom lengqu' lut:sen:nolink} "Stories travel faster than a Khrun"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a tax paid to the government when either buying or selling something. This would also be used for "sales tax" or VAT (value-added tax) if there were no reason to make a further distinction.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an application of {Hur:n:1} used in the sense of background music, instrumental background, background signal, and so on.[1]
This was defined as "background" with an explanation. The bracketed part was added for clarity.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb developed from {HurwI':n}. Applied to a {HurwI':n:nolink}, this refers to the act of pulling back the string of the bow (before releasing and launching the arrow). In other contexts, it may refer to pulling the handle on a door to open or close the door or to pulling on someone's suspenders.[1] For pulling involving movement of the thing being pulled, see {Hoq:v}. For a sudden pull, see {luH:v:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This isn't a Klingon device, but Klingons have learned about it. Originally, it was called a {HurDagh chuHwI':n} by analogy, but over time this got shortened to {HurwI':n:nolink}. From this, a new verb {Hur:v} developed. Some Klingons refer to a bow as a {Ho'yI':n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the general term for a musical instrument with strings ({SIrgh:n}), which one may either pluck ({pang:v}) or strum ({yach:v:2}). To vary the sound, one "fingers" ({Heng:v}) the strings (touch them at different points while plucking or strumming).[1]
Types of {HurDagh:n:nolink} include the {Supghew:n} (small), the {leSpal:n} (medium), and the {tIngDagh:n} (large).
A {HurDagh:n:nolink} is not generally played with a bow, but a {ngItHel:n} may be plucked, strummed, or bowed.

Tämä on yleisnimi kielisoittimille ({SIrgh:n}), joita joko näppäillään ({pang:v}) tai rämpytellään ({yach:v:2}). Äänen muuttamiseksi kieliä painellaan ({Heng:v}) toisella kädellä yhtä aikaa näppäillessä tai rämpyttäessä toisella kädellä.
{HurDagh:n:nolink}-soittimia ovat {Supghew:n} (pieni), {leSpal:n} (keskikoko) ja {tIngDagh:n} (suuri).
{HurDagh:n:nolink}-soitinta ei yleensä soiteta jousella, mutta toisaalta {ngItHel:n}-soitinta voi näppäillä tai rämpyttää jousella soittamisen lisäksi.[1]
The "hurdy gurdy" is a type of stringed instrument.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Klingon Empire has ships which could both fly and submerge underwater. Whether this refers specifically to a submarine or a blimp depends on context. To differentiate them, a submarine would be a {bIQ Hurgh Duj:n@@bIQ:n, Hurgh Duj:n} and a blimp would be a {muD Hurgh Duj:n@@muD:n:1, Hurgh Duj:n}.[1] A {Hurgh Duj:n:nolink} typically has a motor for propulsion.[2]
This word and information about it were revealed in conversation during the {qepHom:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is an idiom, {wIH; Hur'Iqngan rur@@wIH:v, Hur'Iqngan:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used, for example, for hanging a coat on a hook or clothes on a clothesline. But it's not used for a spider dangling from a silk thread or a pair of shoes dangling by their laces from an overhead power line, which is {tlhep:v}.
This is not used to mean "execute by hanging", which is {jIb:v}.
It's confirmed this takes an object.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word also has a slang meaning (see {HutmaH:n:2}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used in the slang expression {HutmaH chav:sen@@HutmaH:n:2, chav:v} "achieve 90" (see {ghuch:v}). Maltz had never heard anyone say {'ebraH chav:sen@@'ebraH:n, chav:v}, mixing the standard word together with the slang.[1]
The movie "Long Shot" (2019) has a controversial sex scene which lasted for 90 seconds.

table.name: mem
table.column: too many people or things in a place at once, traffic jam
zu viele Sachen oder Personen an einem Ort auf einmal
بیش از حد بسیاری از مردم و یا چیزهایی در یک مکان در یک بار [AUTOTRANSLATED]
för många människor/saker på samma plats samtidigt
слишком много людей или вещей в одном месте одновременно [AUTOTRANSLATED]
muitas pessoas ou coisas em um lugar ao mesmo tempo
liikaa asioita tai ihmisiä yhdessä paikassa kerralla
trop de personnes ou de choses dans un endroit à la fois [AUTOTRANSLATED]
This term is used as a play on words, substituting for the curse {Qu'vatlh:excl} in situations where it is appropriate.[1] It is used in vehicular contexts to refer to a "traffic jam".[2]
This word was disclosed during a congested drive on Interstate 95 (i.e., {Hut:n:num}, {vagh:n:1,num}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a small, usually metal, spike typically used for fastening wood.
This is a reference to the industrial rock band "Nine Inch Nails".

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "long nail", and refers to the sticks used in some forms of weaving.

table.name: mem
table.column: The "Phillips-head" screw and screwdriver are named for Henry F. Phillips.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a unit of information in computer science.
John Hutton played Claude Shannon in the 2018 film "The Bit Player".

table.name: mem
table.column: lack, be without, to not have
не хватать, быть без, не иметь [AUTOTRANSLATED]
manquer, être sans, ne pas avoir [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: être clair, ne pas être gêné [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used both for singing without words and for the sound a (not huge) engine makes.[1] It's also used for the sound of a cat (purr).[1; 2]

table.name: mem
table.column: be spicy, be piquant, be hot
être épicé, être piquant, être chaud [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Huy Fong Foods is a hot sauce company, whose most popular product is sriracha sauce.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a slang use of {Huy:v:2} to mean {qIS:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
There is an idiom, {val; Huy' rur@@val:v, Huy':n, rur:v}.[2]
Klingons generally can't raise their eyebrows (other than those suffering from the aftereffects of the Augment crisis). Nevertheless, there are a couple of ways to describe this facial movement commonly seen in other species. The most frequently heard involves the verb {wanHa':v} (or, more commonly, {wanHa'moH:v@@wanHa':v, -moH:v}). Other verbs are also sometimes used, such as {'ob:v} ({'obmoH:v@@'ob:v, -moH:v}) or {SIH:v} ({SIHmoH:v@@SIH:v, -moH:v}).[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word seems to be composed of {Huy':n} and {Dung:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: The fact that this is homophonous with {Hu':v} may have to do with how many times one has gotten up (from sleep) since the day in question. Note that {leS:n:nolink} is also homophonous with {leS:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a filler word. It's sometimes {Hu'mI:sen:nolink} and sometimes just {Hu:sen:nolink}. Another pause vocalization is just a low-toned {ghghgh:sen:nolink}.[1]
The character Ralph Kramden on the TV show "The Honeymooners" would say this when at a loss for words.
